intro: Cyathorhachis wallichiana, commonly known as the Himalayan corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, nodding flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool and moist conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often hairy, while its stems are erect and branched. Cyathorhachis wallichiana is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
